channel.title: üè¢ University of Hong Kong on NeurIPS 2024
channel.description: Recent content in üè¢ University of Hong Kong on NeurIPS 2024

item.title: AutoPSV: Automated Process-Supervised Verifier
item.description: AutoPSV automates process annotation for LLMs, improving reasoning by detecting confidence shifts in reasoning steps, thus efficiently enhancing model performance.

item.title: EffiLearner: Enhancing Efficiency of Generated Code via Self-Optimization
item.description: EFFI-LEARNER: A novel self-optimization framework dramatically improves the efficiency of LLM-generated code by iteratively refining code based on execution profiles.

item.title: HHD-GP: Incorporating Helmholtz-Hodge Decomposition into Gaussian Processes for Learning Dynamical Systems
item.description: HHD-GP leverages Helmholtz-Hodge decomposition within Gaussian Processes to learn physically meaningful components of dynamical systems, enhancing prediction accuracy and interpretability.

item.title: How Transformers Utilize Multi-Head Attention in In-Context Learning? A Case Study on Sparse Linear Regression
item.description: Multi-head transformers utilize distinct attention patterns across layers‚Äîmultiple heads are essential for initial data preprocessing, while a single head suffices for subsequent optimization steps, o…

item.title: KptLLM: Unveiling the Power of Large Language Model for Keypoint Comprehension
item.description: KptLLM: A novel multimodal model leverages LLMs for superior keypoint comprehension, outperforming existing methods in various benchmarks.

item.title: MAGIS: LLM-Based Multi-Agent Framework for GitHub Issue Resolution
item.description: MAGIS: A novel LLM-based multi-agent framework significantly boosts GitHub issue resolution by leveraging agent collaboration for planning and coding, achieving an eight-fold performance increase comp…

item.title: Scalable and Effective Arithmetic Tree Generation for Adder and Multiplier Designs
item.description: ArithTreeRL, a novel reinforcement learning approach, generates optimized arithmetic tree structures for adders and multipliers, significantly improving computational efficiency and reducing hardware …

item.title: Splatter a Video: Video Gaussian Representation for Versatile Processing
item.description: Researchers introduce Video Gaussian Representation (VGR) for versatile video processing, embedding videos into explicit 3D Gaussians for intuitive motion and appearance modeling.

item.title: Stacking Your Transformers: A Closer Look at Model Growth for Efficient LLM Pre-Training
item.description: Stacking Your Transformers accelerates LLM pre-training by leveraging smaller, pre-trained models to efficiently train larger ones, achieving significant speedups and improved performance.

item.title: SyncVIS: Synchronized Video Instance Segmentation
item.description: SyncVIS: A new framework for video instance segmentation achieves state-of-the-art results by synchronously modeling video and frame-level information, overcoming limitations of asynchronous approache…

item.title: Task-oriented Time Series Imputation Evaluation via Generalized Representers
item.description: Task-oriented time series imputation is revolutionized! This research introduces a novel approach that efficiently assesses imputation strategies based on downstream task performance without costly mo…

item.title: What Makes CLIP More Robust to Long-Tailed Pre-Training Data? A Controlled Study for Transferable Insights
item.description: CLIP’s robustness to long-tailed pre-training data stems from its dynamic classification task and descriptive language supervision, offering transferable insights for improving model generalizability.

item.title: Zero-shot Image Editing with Reference Imitation
item.description: MimicBrush: a novel image editing approach using reference imitation for intuitive zero-shot edits.
